item.description:
This is a trail that starts off of NH Route 114 in Goffstown  and goes all the way to the back of the 4H Fairgrounds in New Boston along an old railrod bed that is blocked off to all motorized vehicles.  It is a great hike with the trails on the opposite side of the Piscataquog River, away from the road.  Almost the whole length of the trail is in New Boston with only a relatively short section in Goffstown.

This will be a line hike where at the turnaround point we will simply come back the exact same way.  Thus anyone needing to cut the hike shorter can simply retrace their steps along the same easy to follow trail.

As this was originally a member initiated hike suggested at least way back in October of 2010 and you have RSVP'ed to it before a date and time for the hike was picked please update your Yes RSVP to a No if you can no long attend for the date and time indicated.

As the trail is relatively flat I plan on doing about a 5 mile round trip hike (2.5 miles one way)

 

The above photo which shows the entrance/intersection for the fairground is the first picture in the photo album for this meetup if you want to look at an enlarged version of it.  Thanks Christine D., Gaby L., and Liz P. for making the photo available for use and checking out the parking lot.
item.how_to_find_us: Enter Hillsdale Lane in New Boston off of/near 105 River Road/ NH Rt. 13 to enter the 4-H Fairgrounds. Follow the road to the back of the Fairground to the parking lot for the trail head. At any intersection stay to the right and go straight ahead.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Old Rail Trail along the Piscataquog River
